The claim is based on a video from a rig: wing activist organization, Project Veritas, which features a so-called whistleblower making allegations of election fraud in Michigan.
The authenticity of the claim is unprove: as there is no concrete evidence provided to support the allegations made in the video.
The U: S. Postal Service inspector general’s office is currently investigating the complaint, but no additional information is available at this time.
Even if the allegations were true: Michigan law clearly states that mail-in ballots must reach the clerk or an authorized assistant of the clerk before the close of the polls on election day, and any ballots received thereafter, regardless of the postmark, will not be counted.
